detaileddescription.para: creates the handler for bivariate constraints and includes it in SCIP

memberdef.argsstring: (SCIP *scip, SCIP_CONS **cons, const char *name, SCIP_EXPRTREE *f, SCIP_BIVAR_CONVEXITY convextype, SCIP_VAR *z, SCIP_Real zcoef, SCIP_Real lhs, SCIP_Real rhs, SCIP_Bool initial, SCIP_Bool separate, SCIP_Bool enforce, SCIP_Bool check, SCIP_Bool propagate, SCIP_Bool local, SCIP_Bool modifiable, SCIP_Bool dynamic, SCIP_Bool removable, SCIP_Bool stickingatnode)
memberdef.name: SCIPcreateConsBivariate

briefdescription.para: pointer to hold the created constraint
expression tree specifying bivariate function f(x,y)
should the LP relaxation of constraint be in the initial LP? Usually set to TRUE. Set to FALSE for 'lazy constraints'.
should the constraint be separated during LP processing? Usually set to TRUE.
should the constraint be enforced during node processing? TRUE for model constraints, FALSE for additional, redundant constraints.
should the constraint be checked for feasibility? TRUE for model constraints, FALSE for additional, redundant constraints.
should the constraint be propagated during node processing? Usually set to TRUE.
is constraint only valid locally? Usually set to FALSE. Has to be set to TRUE, e.g., for branching constraints.
is constraint modifiable (subject to column generation)? Usually set to FALSE. In column generation applications, set to TRUE if pricing adds coefficients to this constraint.
is constraint subject to aging? Usually set to FALSE. Set to TRUE for own cuts which are seperated as constraints.
should the relaxation be removed from the LP due to aging or cleanup? Usually set to FALSE. Set to TRUE for 'lazy constraints' and 'user cuts'.
should the constraint always be kept at the node where it was added, even if it may be moved to a more global node? Usually set to FALSE. Set to TRUE to for constraints that represent node data.

detaileddescription.para: creates and captures a bivariate constraint

simplesect.para: the constraint gets captured, hence at one point you have to release it using the method SCIPreleaseCons()

memberdef.argsstring: (SCIP *scip, SCIP_CONS **cons, const char *name, SCIP_EXPRTREE *f, SCIP_BIVAR_CONVEXITY convextype, SCIP_VAR *z, SCIP_Real zcoef, SCIP_Real lhs, SCIP_Real rhs)
memberdef.name: SCIPcreateConsBasicBivariate

briefdescription.para: pointer to hold the created constraint
expression tree specifying bivariate function f(x,y)

detaileddescription.para: creates and captures an absolute power constraint in its most basic version, i. e., all constraint flags are set to their basic value as explained for the method SCIPcreateConsBivariate(); all flags can be set via SCIPconsSetFLAGNAME-methods in cons.h

simplesect.para: SCIPcreateConsBivariate() for information about the basic constraint flag configuration
the constraint gets captured, hence at one point you have to release it using the method SCIPreleaseCons()

detaileddescription.para: gets the linear variable of a bivariate constraint, or NULL if no such variable
gets the coefficients of the linear variable of a bivariate constraint
gets the expression tree of a bivariate constraint
gets the left hand side of a bivariate constraint
gets the right hand side of a bivariate constraint

briefdescription.para: constraint handler for bivariate nonlinear constraints $\textrm{lhs} \leq f(x,y) + c z \leq \textrm{rhs}$

detaileddescription.para:
Martin Ballerstein
Dennis Michaels
Stefan Vigerske This constraint handler handles constraints of the form \[ \textrm{lhs} \leq f(x,y) + c z \leq \textrm{rhs} \] for a bivariate nonlinear function $f(x,y)$ (given as expression tree) that has a fixed convexity behaviour, that is, $f(x,y)$ has to be either jointly convex in $(x,y)$, or convex in $x$ and concave in $y$, or convex in $x$ and convex in $y$, but indefinite w.r.t. $(x,y)$. See also

simplesect.para: Martin Ballerstein, Dennis Michaels, and Stefan Vigerske Linear Underestimators for bivariate functions with a fixed convexity behavior ZIB Report 13-02, 2013. http://opus4.kobv.de/opus4-zib/frontdoor/index/index/docId/1764
